alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Monongalia; Wetzel (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 10:50AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Fayette, Greene, Washington and Westmoreland. Portions of West Virginia, including the following counties, Marshall, Monongalia and Wetzel. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1050 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Uniontown, Connellsville, Waynesburg, Monessen, California, Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, Charleroi, Masontown, Bentleyville, Brownsville, New Stanton, Fredericktown- Millsboro, South Connellsville, Perryopolis, Fairdale, Jefferson Boro, Point Marion, Cameron and Hundred. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
